instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00840-A no power, mac heats up and sometimes coller turns
threads.message:
helo, my friend I'm with this mac that has been in contact with liquid, the machine seems to turn on, but it doesn't show an image. the components D330 and D3300 are missing and it is slightly cracked. The region around U8400 suffered from oxidation, where I had to make a jumper in the ISNS_LCDBKLT_P U8400/c5452 mesh.

Voltage: PPbus_g3h 13.09V; PP3V3_G3H 3.42V; PP5V_S0 5.13v.

threads.title: 820-00840-A no power, mac heats up and sometimes coller turns
threads.message:
Missing image and backlight at same time?

Did you check for USB activity?

threads.title: 820-00840-A no power, mac heats up and sometimes coller turns
threads.message:
I noticed that the ISNS_LCDBKLT_P track didn't have a pad connection to the board, so I performed a jumper from IC U8400 to C5452.

Mac powers the external SSD, but does not start the external ssd. No image on HDMI.

threads.title: 820-00840-A no power, mac heats up and sometimes coller turns
threads.message:
No reason to search for image/backlight, if you cannot confirm USB activity.
I suppose the board has more corroded points...

threads.title: 820-00840-A no power, mac heats up and sometimes coller turns
threads.message: Not from the image and not even the sound signal that it is connecting, can be the BIOS causing it ?

threads.title: 820-00840-A no power, mac heats up and sometimes coller turns
820-00840-A no power, mac heats up and sometimes coller turns
threads.message: Do you think Bios is corrupted, and putting another BIOS file will solve it?

threads.title: 820-00840-A no power, mac heats up and sometimes coller turns
threads.message:
I can suppose that, but not sure.
If you do not try, will never know...

threads.title: 820-00840-A no power, mac heats up and sometimes coller turns
threads.message:
I rewrote BIOS, but it still has the same defect.
In the thermal camera it starts q3100 the component that presents greater heating.

threads.title: 820-00840-A no power, mac heats up and sometimes coller turns
threads.message: If you connect charger to the other port, Q3100 is still the hotest?

threads.title: 820-00840-A no power, mac heats up and sometimes coller turns
threads.message: In the first door there is no heating in Q3100, but in the second door yes.

threads.title: 820-00840-A no power, mac heats up and sometimes coller turns
threads.message:
You still have board areas affected by liquid, maybe even CPU is bad.
You should try first to heat BGA chips with quality flux and pass the board through ultrasonic cleaner at the end.
